clumpy.definition.Land¶

class clumpy.definition.Land(features, de='gkde', isl_ratio=1.0, verbose=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Land object which refers to a given initial state.

Parameters

  • features (list(FeaturesLayer) or list(State)) – List of features where a State means a distance layer to the corresponding state.

  • de ({'gkde'} or DensityEstimator, default='gkde') –

    Density estimation for \(P(x|u)\).

    gkde : Gaussian Kernel Density Estimation method

  • verbose (int, default=None) – Verbosity level.

Methods

add_conditional_density_estimation(state[, de])

Add conditional density for a given final state.

add_transition_patches(state, transition_patches)

Add transition patches for a given final state.

get_values(state, luc_initial[, luc_final, …])

Get values.
add_conditional_density_estimation(state, de='gkde')[source]¶

Add conditional density for a given final state.

Parameters

  • state (State) – The final state.

  • de ({'gkde'} or DensityEstimator, default='gkde') –

    Density estimation for \(P(x|u,v)\).

    gkde : Gaussian Kernel Density Estimation method

Returns

self – The self object.

Return type

Land

add_transition_patches(state, transition_patches)[source]¶

Add transition patches for a given final state.

Parameters

  • state (State) – The final state.

  • transition_patches (TransitionPatches) – The transition patches

Returns

self – The self object.

Return type

Land

get_values(state, luc_initial, luc_final=None, region=None, explanatory_variables=True, distances={})[source]¶

Get values.

Parameters

  • state (State) – The studied initial state.

  • luc_initial (LandUseLayer) – The initial land use layer.

  • luc_final (LandUseLayer, default=None) – The final land use layer. Ignored if None.

  • region (LandUseLayer, default=None) – The region mask layer. If None, the whole area is studied.

  • explanatory_variables (bool, default=True) – If True, features values are returned.

  • distances (dict(ndarray)) – A dict of ndarray distances to the State used as key. Usefull to avoid redondant distance computations.

Returns

  • J (ndarray of shape (n_samples,)) – The samples flat indexes.

  • X (ndarray of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Returned if explanatory_variables is True. The features values.

  • V (ndarray of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Returned if luc_final is not None. The final state values.
